title: "What is the meaning of the book 'Das Initiaten-BeWuSStSein' and its relevance to out of body experiences?"
first_phrase: In the previous section, the author recounted a strange experience where he felt suspended in the void, helpless and unable to move. In this final part, he mentions a book that helped him make sense of his experiences - "Das Initiaten-BeWuSStSein" by R. Steiner. Although the author has reservations about Steiner's ideas, he finds the book valuable. However, he admits that he may not be forgiven by those seeking sensationalistic visions like Swedenborg and Leadbeater. This section delves into the concept of the "doppio" or double, and the solar consciousness.

last_phrase: In conclusion, it is crucial to be cautious when exploring the realms beyond our physical reality. While intriguing, it is easy to fall into the false path of mystical illusions and demonic forces. As with the author's experience, it is essential to listen to the warning signs and approach such experiences with a discerning mind.
